TopicTitle: This Is The Guy That Got Me Into KSP...

Articles.Content: Nerd3.... omg does he make me laugh....
yeah, i was in the middle of watching that; i actually found him because of KSP... well his dad playing it; he does some hilariously great eps
I normally get bugged when people start doing things completely wrong in a game when I know what to do. I still like Nerdcubed, though. He's awesome.
As much as I love him, it pains me to watch videos of people who have no idea how to play KSP.

As much as I love him, it pains me to watch videos of people who have no idea how to play KSP.

Happens to me to. I try to avoid watching those (along with Tobuscus playing Minecraft).

I mean... "OPEN THE PARACHUTE ON THE MUN" and I was like "HUH?"

ROFL

I swear he is bad for my health... I always have aching ribs after watching his vids.

yeah, i have a similar problem with puzzle games; but the comedy factor was worth it (even if i was screaming internally for him to do it right!)

for example, i couldnt watch scott manley play antichamber... that was so annoying to watch haha; i just dont like watching puzzle games that i have solved, or solved before the player (not the fault of the player, its always easier to solve i find, in a vid...)
I was sceptic, but he earned a subscriber whit those "intergalactic space nipples".

I warn you, if you watch his Bus Simulator vids be prepared to call the ambulance as you laugh so hard you bust a rib. Oh and his Far Cry 3 ones are realllllllllllllly funny too.

I've been waiting for him to do more KSP though. The previous one was a really old version. Still, as soon as I saw it I stopped his vid and had bought KSP in less than 5 minutes lol - It just was one of those games that attracted me where Minecraft did not.

One thing confused me about the the above vid though... HOW DID THAT KERBAL SURVIVE (the one who fell off the rocket and BOUNCED).

I warn you, if you watch his Bus Simulator vids be prepared to call the ambulance as you laugh so hard you bust a rib. Oh and his Far Cry 3 ones are realllllllllllllly funny too.

I've been waiting for him to do more KSP though. The previous one was a really old version. Still, as soon as I saw it I stopped his vid and had bought KSP in less than 5 minutes lol - It just was one of those games that attracted me where Minecraft did not.

One thing confused me about the the above vid though... HOW DID THAT KERBAL SURVIVE (the one who fell off the rocket and BOUNCED).

Kerbals who fall on their heads seem to live.

As much as I love him, it pains me to watch videos of people who have no idea how to play KSP.

This. I unsubscribed to the person that introduced me to KSP because he simply had no idea how to play KSP. But this guy is hilarious!

Hi,

Yeah I watched this a little...and yes it is hilarius!

One can always find humour somewhere - and thats a good thing.

I dont find humour in things all the time though, and sometimes take things too seriously - but that is just who I am...I am kind of a serious fellow, and I do intend to take the game to it's serious potential; one simply cannot laugh at somethin bein blown up after you spent an hour building it...but it happens and ya so laff anyways cause you can always try again thats the beauty of it.

Thing is KSP can be as demanding or as fun as anyone wants to make it ! Again more beauty of KSP !

Cdr Zeta KSP Roleplayer, ARG (Alternate Reality Game) 'er, Einstein in progress, and Newton's Protege (sp?!)?!

I think you mean prodigy, Zeta, but I get it. I hate it when the word is on the tip of your tongue but you just can't get it out.

One thing about watching that video "a little", the further into the vid, the funnier he gets. The first third is only mildly funny... it's when he gets into space that it gets hilarious... But like others have said, you want to scream advice at him because there is SOOOOOOOOOOOOOOO much he doesn't know what to do but that is what makes it hilarious.

Oh and that first one that he forgot to put struts on.... I've never had a rocket do that lol...
Personally I like watching Scott Manley for his videos like the reusable space program. Though the youtuber who got me into KSP is Robbaz King of space, and head of Viking Aerospace Engineering.
